scenes.verse: In those days John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness crying out: "Prepare a way for the Lord!"
"Make his paths straight; for he guides are feet into the way of peace."
"He gives light to those who live in darkness; and all mankind shall see the salvation of God."
When all the people asked him, "What must we do then?" he answered, "Anyone who has two tunics must share with the one who has none."
"And the one with something to eat must do the same."
And he said, "Someone is coming, someone more powerful than I am."
"I have baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire."
Then Jesus came to be baptized by John, and John said, "Look, there is the Lamb of God that takes away the sins of the world."
And Jesus was baptized by John, and suddenly the heavens opened.
And the Holy Spirit descended on him like a dove. And a voice spoke from Heaven, "This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased."
There was a wedding at Cana at Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there. Jesus and his disciples had also been invited.
When the wine provided for the wedding was all finished, the mother Jesus said to him, "They have no wine."
Jesus said, "Woman, why turn to me? My hours has not yet come."
She said to the servants, "Do whatever he tells you." So he told them, "Fill the jars with water."
"Now take some to the steward." When the steward tasted it he exclaimed, "You have kept the best wine till now!"
This was the first of the signs given by Jesus, and his disciples believed in him.
Then he came to Judea and some Pharisees asked him, "Is is against the law for a man to divorce his wife?"
Jesus said, "From the beginning of creation, God made them male and female."
"This is why a man must leave his father and mother, and be joined to his wife."
"They are no longer two, therefore, but one body. So then, what God has united, man must not divide."
After John had been arrested, Jesus went into Galilee. There he proclaimed the Good News from God.
"The time has come; the kingdom of God is close at hand! Repent and believe in the Gospel."
And he taught: "The kingdom of God is like a treasure hidden in a field, which someone has found."
"He goes off happy, sells everything he owns and buys the field."
"The kingdom of God is among you. So walk while you have the light, or darkness will overtake you."
"You are the light of the world, buy your light must shine to give praise to your Father in heaven."
"For much will be required of those to whom much is given."
"And once the hand is laid on the plow, no one who looks back is fit for the kingdom of God."
And Jesus called a little child to him, and put his arms around him.
Saying, "I tell you solemnly, anyone who does not welcome the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it."
Jesus went up a high mountain to pray; and he took with him Peter and James and John.
As he prayed, he was transfigured. His face shone like the sun and his clothes became as dazzling as light.
Suddenly Moses and Elijah were there, speaking of his passing in Jerusalem.
Then Peter spoke to Jesus, "Lord, it is wonderful for us to be here."
As he spoke, a cloud covered them, and the disciples were afraid.
And a voice come from the cloud, "This is my Son, the Chosen One; with whom I am well pleased. Listen to him."
And the disciples fell face down on the ground, overcame with fear.
But Jesus come up and touched them, saying, "Stand up, do not be afraid."
And when they raised their eyes they saw no one but only Jesus.
And Jesus ordered them: "Tell no one about the vision, until the Son of Man has risen from the dead."
"I am the living bread which has come down from heaven. Anyone who eats this bread will live forever."
"For my flesh is real food, and my blood is real drink."
"Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood lives in me, and I live in him."
After this, many of disciples left him. The Jesus said to the Twelve, "Do you want to go away too?"
Peter answered, "Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the message of eternal life."
"And we believe, and have come to know, that you are the Holy One of God."
Noe on the night he was betrayed, the Lord Jesus took some bread, and broke it.
And he gave it to the disciples, saying, "Take it and eat. This is my body."
Then he took a cup, and gave it to them. "Drink from this, all of you," he said.
"For this is my blood, the blood of the new covenant, which is to be poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins."
